channel.title: What to get?
channel.description:
Well, I've come into some cash recently, and I've decided I'm going to purchase one of the three things I've listed here. And I was hoping for some input about each item if anyone already has one of these. I'll list the specs on each, and the price. I know most people will say I'm crazy and the obvious choice should be the MacBook. But since it's so costly, I'm looking at just buying the BlackJack 2, and the Nikon D40X.
[center] [size=16pt][font=Verdana]Samsung Blackjack II SGH-i617[/font][/size] [img]https://www.wireless.att.com/businesscenter/blackjack2/images/Samsung_BlackJack2_lp.jpg[/img][/center] Operating System Windows Mobile 6.0 Standard Band GSM 850/900/1800/1900MHz, UMTS 850/1900/2100MHz Data GPRS/EDGE/WCDMA/HSDPA Size 114mm x 61mm x 13mm (4.5"x2.4"x.5) Weight 116g (4.1oz) Battery Life Up to 14 days standby Up to 5.5 hours talk time Main Display 2.4" 65k color TFT, QVGA (320x240 pixel) resolution Camera 2 megapixel Video Video capture/playback Messaging MMS/SMS Email IMAP/SMTP/POP Bluetooth Yes w/ A2DP (stereo) Memory 125MB, microSD memory card slot up to 8GB Availability Now Other Media player, AT&T video share, built-in GPS, TeleNav GPS Navigator support, speakerphone, web browser
[center][size=16pt][font=Verdana]Nikon D40X DSLR 10.2mp[/font][/size] [img]http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/51HAcDjD-PL._AA280_.jpg[/img][/center]
* 10.2-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for large, photo-quality prints * 2.5-inch LCD monitor; 170-degree viewing angle * 3D Color Matrix Metering II for ideal exposures in almost any lighting condition * Image optimization functions and in-camera image retouching * Includes 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6G ED-IF AF-S DX Zoom-Nikkor lens
[center][size=16pt][font=Verdana]Macbook Pro 17in. 2.6GHz Intel Core 2 Duo[/font][/size] [img]http://img524.imageshack.us/img524/2131/macbookproel5.jpg[/img] [/center]
OS: -Mac OS X Leopard Display: 17-inch Glossy Dislpay Processor: 2.6GHz Intel Core 2 Duo processor, 4MB on-chip shared L2 cache running 1:1 with processor speed Ram: 2GB (two SO-DIMMs) of PC2-5300 (667MHz) DDR2 memory; two SO-DIMM slots support up to 4GB 800MHz frontside bus Ports: -One FireWire 400 port -One FireWire 800 port -Three 480-Mbps USB 2.0 ports -ExpressCard/34 slot Power: -68-watt-hour lithium-polymer battery (with integrated charge indicator LEDs) providing up to 5.75 hours of battery life -85W MagSafe Power Adapter with cable management system -MagSafe power adapter port Communications: -Built-in AirPort Extreme Wi-Fi wireless networking (based on an IEEE 802.11n draft specification); IEEE 802.11a/b/g compatible2 -Built-in Bluetooth 2.0+EDR (Enhanced Data Rate) -Built-in 10/100/1000BASE-T Gigabit Ethernet (RJ-45 connector) Graphics Card: -NVIDIA GeForce 8600M GT graphics processor with dual-link DVI support and 256MB of GDDR3 SDRAM HD: -200GB 7200-rpm or 250GB 5400-rpm drive3 DVD Drive: 8x slot-loading SuperDrive (DVD±R DL/DVD±RW/CD-RW)
That's about it. I can't really think of anything else. If you all have any suggestions, or have a review of one of these items, give it to me. I want to be sure of what I'm getting.

So the phone gets the vote![/quote]

item.title: What to get?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

       Well, I've come into some cash recently, and I've decided I'm going to purchase one of the three things I've listed here. And I was hoping for some input about each item if anyone already has one of these. I'll list the specs on each, and the price. I know most people will say I'm crazy and the obvious choice should be the MacBook. But since it's so costly, I'm looking at just buying the BlackJack 2, and the Nikon D40X.

[center]
[size=16pt][font=Verdana]Samsung Blackjack II SGH-i617[/font][/size]
[/center]
Operating System Windows Mobile 6.0 Standard
Band GSM 850/900/1800/1900MHz, UMTS 850/1900/2100MHz
Data GPRS/EDGE/WCDMA/HSDPA
Size 114mm x 61mm x 13mm
(4.5"x2.4"x.5)
Weight 116g (4.1oz)
Battery Life Up to 14 days standby
Up to 5.5 hours talk time
Main Display 2.4" 65k color TFT, QVGA (320x240 pixel) resolution
Camera 2 megapixel
Video Video capture/playback
Messaging MMS/SMS
Email IMAP/SMTP/POP
Bluetooth Yes w/ A2DP (stereo)
Memory 125MB, microSD memory card slot up to 8GB
Availability Now
Other Media player, AT&T video share, built-in GPS, TeleNav GPS Navigator support, speakerphone, web browser

[center][size=16pt][font=Verdana]Nikon D40X DSLR 10.2mp[/font][/size]
[/center]

* 10.2-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for large, photo-quality prints
* 2.5-inch LCD monitor; 170-degree viewing angle
* 3D Color Matrix Metering II for ideal exposures in almost any lighting condition
* Image optimization functions and in-camera image retouching
* Includes 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6G ED-IF AF-S DX Zoom-Nikkor lens

[center][size=16pt][font=Verdana]Macbook Pro 17in. 2.6GHz Intel Core 2 Duo[/font][/size]

[/center]

OS:
-Mac OS X Leopard
Display:
17-inch Glossy Dislpay
Processor:
2.6GHz Intel Core 2 Duo processor, 4MB on-chip shared L2 cache running 1:1 with processor speed
Ram:
2GB (two SO-DIMMs) of PC2-5300 (667MHz) DDR2 memory; two SO-DIMM slots support up to 4GB
800MHz frontside bus
Ports:
-One FireWire 400 port
-One FireWire 800 port
-Three 480-Mbps USB 2.0 ports
-ExpressCard/34 slot
Power:
-68-watt-hour lithium-polymer battery (with integrated charge indicator LEDs) providing up to 5.75 hours of battery life
-85W MagSafe Power Adapter with cable management system
-MagSafe power adapter port
Communications:
-Built-in AirPort Extreme Wi-Fi wireless networking (based on an IEEE 802.11n draft specification); IEEE 802.11a/b/g compatible2
-Built-in Bluetooth 2.0+EDR (Enhanced Data Rate)
-Built-in 10/100/1000BASE-T Gigabit Ethernet (RJ-45 connector)
Graphics Card:
-NVIDIA GeForce 8600M GT graphics processor with dual-link DVI support and 256MB of GDDR3 SDRAM
HD:
-200GB 7200-rpm or 250GB 5400-rpm drive3
DVD Drive:
8x slot-loading SuperDrive (DVD±R DL/DVD±RW/CD-RW)

That’s about it. I can’t really think of anything else. If you all have any suggestions, or have a review of one of these items, give it to me. I want to be sure of what I’m getting.
